00007 #include "ext.h"

00010 #include "ext_strings.h"
00011 
00012 
00013 #define DATABASE_SQL_MAXLEN 4096
00014 // Define the macro below to enable debug code
00015 //#define DATABASE_DEBUG
00016 
00017 
00018 t_max_err db_open(t_symbol *dbname, const char *filename, t_database **db)
00019 {
00020     long    ac=0;
00021     t_atom  av[6];
00022     
00023     if (*db)
00024         object_free(*db);
00025     
00026     if (filename) {
00027         atom_setsym(av+ac, gensym("@rambased"));
00028         ac++;
00029         atom_setlong(av+ac, 0);
00030         ac++;
00031         atom_setsym(av+ac, gensym("@filename"));
00032         ac++;
00033         atom_setsym(av+ac, gensym((char*)filename));
00034         ac++;
00035     }
00036     atom_setsym(av+ac, gensym("@db"));
00037     ac++;
00038     atom_setsym(av+ac, dbname);
00039     ac++;
00040     
00041     *db = (t_database*)object_new_typed(_sym_nobox, _sym_sqlite, ac, av);
00042     if (!*db)
00043         return MAX_ERR_GENERIC;
00044     
00045     return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00046 }
00047 
00048 t_max_err db_close(t_database **db)
00049 {
00050     object_free(*db);
00051     *db = NULL;
00052     return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00053 }
00054 
00055 
00056 t_max_err db_query(t_database *db, t_db_result **dbresult, const char *s, ...)
00057 {
00058     char    sql[DATABASE_SQL_MAXLEN+2];
00059     va_list ap;
00060     int     err = 0;
00061     int     len = 0;
00062 
00063     if (db) {
00064         va_start(ap, s);
00065 
00066         len = vsnprintf(sql, DATABASE_SQL_MAXLEN, s, ap);
00067         sql[DATABASE_SQL_MAXLEN] = '\0';
00068         if (len >= DATABASE_SQL_MAXLEN) {
00069             cpost("DB: Query Overrun!\n");
00070             return MAX_ERR_GENERIC;
00071         }
00072         err = (int)object_method(db, _sym_execstring, sql, dbresult);
00073 #ifdef DATABASE_DEBUG
00074         cpost("SQL: %s\n", sql);
00075         if (err)
00076             cpost("   ERROR: %i\n", err);
00077 #endif // DATABASE_DEBUG        
00078         }
00079     return err;
00080 }
00081 
00082 t_max_err db_query_silent(t_database *db, t_db_result **dbresult, const char *s, ...)
00083 {
00084     char        sql[DATABASE_SQL_MAXLEN+2];
00085     va_list     ap;
00086     long        logging = false;
00087     t_max_err   err;
00088 
00089     va_start(ap, s);
00090     vsnprintf(sql, DATABASE_SQL_MAXLEN, s, ap);
00091     sql[DATABASE_SQL_MAXLEN] = '\0';
00092 
00093     logging = object_attr_getlong(db, _sym_log);
00094     object_attr_setlong(db, _sym_log, 0);
00095     err = db_query(db, dbresult, sql, NULL);
00096     object_attr_setlong(db, _sym_log, logging);
00097     return err;
00098 }
00099 
00100 t_max_err db_query_getlastinsertid(t_database *db, long *id)
00101 {
00102     *id = (long)object_method(db, _sym_getlastinsertid);
00103     return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00104 }
00105 
00106 
00107 t_max_err db_query_table_new(t_database *db, const char *tablename)
00108 {
00109     char    idname[256];
00110     
00111     // SQLite won't let us add primary keys later, so we have to add it now.
00112     strncpy_zero(idname, tablename, 256);
00113     
00114     // singularize
00115     if (idname[strlen(idname)-1 == 's'])
00116         idname[strlen(idname)-1] = 0;
00117     
00118     return db_query(db, NULL, "CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS %s ( %s_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY NOT NULL )", tablename, idname);
00119 }
00120 
00121 t_max_err db_query_table_addcolumn(t_database *db, const char *tablename, const char *columnname, const char *columntype, const char *flags)
00122 {
00123     if (flags)
00124         return db_query_silent(db, NULL, "ALTER TABLE %s ADD COLUMN %s %s %s", tablename, columnname, columntype, flags);
00125     else
00126         return db_query_silent(db, NULL, "ALTER TABLE %s ADD COLUMN %s %s", tablename, columnname, columntype);
00127 }

00130 t_max_err db_transaction_start(t_database *db)
00131 {
00132     return (t_max_err)object_method(db, _sym_starttransaction);
00133 }
00134 
00135 t_max_err db_transaction_end(t_database *db)
00136 {
00137     return (t_max_err)object_method(db, _sym_endtransaction);
00138 }
00139 
00140 t_max_err db_transaction_flush(t_database *db)
00141 {
00142     return (t_max_err)object_method(db, _sym_flush);
00143 }

00146 // DB VIEWS
00147 
00148 t_max_err db_view_create(t_database *db, const char *sql, t_db_view **dbview)
00149 {
00150     *dbview = (t_db_view *)object_method(db, gensym("createview"), gensym((char*)sql));
00151     if (!*dbview)
00152         return MAX_ERR_GENERIC;
00153 
00154     return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00155 }
00156 
00157 t_max_err db_view_remove(t_database *db, t_db_view **dbview)
00158 {
00159     if (db && *dbview)
00160         object_method(db, gensym("removeview"), *dbview);
00161     *dbview = NULL;
00162     return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00163 }
00164 
00165 t_max_err db_view_getresult(t_db_view *dbview, t_db_result **result)
00166 {
00167     if (result){
00168         *result = (t_db_view *)object_method(dbview, gensym("getresult"));
00169         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00170     }
00171     return MAX_ERR_GENERIC;
00172 }
00173 
00174 t_max_err db_view_setquery(t_db_view *dbview, char *newquery)
00175 {
00176     if (dbview)
00177         return object_attr_setsym(dbview, _sym_query, gensym(newquery));
00178     else
00179         return MAX_ERR_GENERIC;
00180 }

00185 char** db_result_nextrecord(t_db_result *result)
00186 {
00187     if (result)
00188         return (char **)object_method(result, _sym_nextrecord);
00189     else
00190         return NULL;
00191 }
00192 
00193 void db_result_reset(t_db_result *result)
00194 {
00195     object_method(result, _sym_reset);
00196 }
00197 
00198 void db_result_clear(t_db_result *result)
00199 {
00200     object_method(result, _sym_clear);
00201 }
00202 
00203 long db_result_numrecords(t_db_result *result)
00204 {
00205     if (result)
00206         return (long)object_method(result, _sym_numrecords);
00207     else
00208         return 0;
00209 }
00210 
00211 long db_result_numfields(t_db_result *result)
00212 {
00213     if (result)
00214         return (long)object_method(result, _sym_numfields);
00215     else
00216         return 0;
00217 }
00218 
00219 char* db_result_fieldname(t_db_result *result, long fieldindex)
00220 {
00221     return (char *)object_method(result, _sym_fieldnamebyindex, fieldindex);
00222 }
00223 
00224 char* db_result_string(t_db_result *result, long recordindex, long fieldindex)
00225 {
00226     return (char *)object_method(result, _sym_valuebyindex, recordindex, fieldindex);
00227 }
00228 
00229 long db_result_long(t_db_result *result, long recordindex, long fieldindex)
00230 {
00231     char*   c = (char *)object_method(result, _sym_valuebyindex, recordindex, fieldindex);
00232     long    l = 0;
00233     
00234     if (c)
00235         sscanf(c, "%ld", &l);
00236     return l;
00237 }
00238 
00239 unsigned long db_result_datetimeinseconds(t_db_result *result, long recordindex, long fieldindex)
00240 {
00241     char            *str = db_result_string(result, recordindex, fieldindex);
00242     unsigned long   seconds = 0;
00243     
00244     if (str)
00245         db_util_stringtodate(str, &seconds);
00246     return seconds;
00247 }
00248 
00249 
00250 // UTILITIES
00251 
00252 void db_util_stringtodate(const char *string, unsigned long *date)
00253 {
00254     t_datetime  datetime;
00255     
00256     sscanf(string, "%4lu-%02lu-%02lu %02lu:%02lu:%02lu",
00257            &datetime.year, &datetime.month, &datetime.day, 
00258            &datetime.hour, &datetime.minute, &datetime.second);
00259     *date = systime_datetoseconds(&datetime);   
00260 }
00261 
00262 void db_util_datetostring(const unsigned long date, char *string)
00263 {
00264     t_datetime  datetime;
00265     
00266     systime_secondstodate(date, &datetime);
00267     sprintf(string, "%4lu-%02lu-%02lu %02lu:%02lu:%02lu", 
00268             datetime.year, datetime.month, datetime.day, 
00269             datetime.hour, datetime.minute, datetime.second);
00270 }
